children: A 23-year-old man is evaluated for a chronic skin condition, as
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

This patient has acne vulgaris, or common acne. Acne vulgaris is characterized by noninflammatory and inflammatory lesions. Noninflammatory lesions are comedones that can be open (blackheads) or closed (whiteheads). Red papules and pustules are inflammatory lesions. This patient has severe inflammatory acne with papules and pustules, large open comedones, marked postinflammatory erythema, and a few atrophic scars.
